info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 15 at 11:35AM MST until October 15 at 12:45PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHWESTERN MOHAVE COUNTY... At 1135 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms which produced heavy rain from Oatman to Fort Mohave. Flash flooding is possible in these areas. More thunderstorms approaching from the east could also continue the flash flood threat. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated rain gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bullhead City, Laughlin, Mesquite Creek, Oatman, Mojave Ranch Estates, Mohave Valley and Willow Valley. Flash Flooding of Silver Creek Road and Bullhead Parkway east of the Fort Mohave area are likely to see washes with flowing water impacting them in several locations. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
